abstract: Temple University Sport Industry Research Center releases study showing 83 percent of major infractions in NCAA Division I from 1953 to 2014 were made by football and men's basketball teams, which also bring in most revenue; other college athletics news noted.
lead_paragraph: Football and men’s basketball, the biggest generators of revenue, accounted for 83 percent of the total from 1953 to 2014, a new study has determined.
snippet: Football and men’s basketball, the biggest generators of revenue, accounted for 83 percent of the total from 1953 to 2014, a new study has determined....

headline.main: Report Says Big-Money College Sports Draw Most Major Infractions
headline.print_headline: Study Says Big-Money Sports Draw Most Major Infractions
